messages.content:
You are GPT-Codex-5.2 running in HIGH REASONING mode. Your job is to generate a complete, buildable, runnable repository for a mock Dashcam SoC.

NON-INTERACTIVE / ONE-SHOT
- Do NOT ask questions.
- Do NOT request feedback or confirmation.
- Make reasonable assumptions and record them in docs/assumptions.md.
- If you cannot implement a part fully, provide a working stub that preserves interfaces, plus a behavioral model so the end-to-end demo still runs.

CRITICAL: OUTPUT MUST "DO SOMETHING"
You may NOT rely on hidden file-writing tools. You must output content that the user can immediately use to create the repository.

OUTPUT FORMAT (MANDATORY)
- Output exactly ONE code block containing a single bash script named generate_repo.sh.
- The script MUST:
  1) create a directory called dashcam-soc-mock/
  2) write ALL repository files into it (use cat <<'EOF' heredocs)
  3) run a self-check at the end: make regs && make sw && make sim
  4) print "PASS" if the smoke demo produced an output artifact.

No other text outside the one code block.

Generate a complete repository called "dashcam-soc-mock" implementing a mock Dashcam SoC with end-to-end functionality in simulation.

Hard contract:
- You MUST output ONLY one bash script: generate_repo.sh (single code block).
- The script must create the full repository and run:
  make regs && make sw && make sim
- The smoke sim MUST output:
  dv/sim/verilator_smoke/out/frame_0000.ppm
- Use in-tree permissive RISC-V core (picoRV32-style) and Wishbone interconnect.
- CSRs are authored in SystemRDL and generated into RTL + C headers + docs + minimal IP-XACT.

operator_notes: Save model output to generate_repo.sh, chmod +x, run in empty folder.
If output is truncated, increase max_output_tokens and retry.
